column4: Is this true? -> all Ubuntu since 8 has compiz and it runs all the time.  (or dont I? - I've noted that I cannot choose to do any of the "special effects".)
~ no that is not true
hi. I have it or I dont?  (I just looked up - what is compiz. Totally curiosity. I dont know if I have a need to know but I have heard the term in here.)
dpkg -l | grep compiz (look for ii in the very first column)

and apt-cache search compiz and see what the small description says (I am using grep there because I don't know if its compiz-bin or some other package name and that will grab ANY compiz related package that is installed and display its status
what happens if you modify your grub.cfg to remove the splash and reboot a few times. see where it's hanging
rerun grub-install /dev/yourdev (whatever your device is)
once you modify the /boot/grub/grub.cfg that is
the old X in the "taskbar" for XCHAT was easy to distinguish and choose. Now there's some vague nubbin. Can I get the X back?
promethes ~ nothing in dmesg or /var/log/lastlog ?
dmesg | less  && tail -n 300 -f /var/log/lastlog
9so when you hit enter at the last line of the dmesgt output it automatically will launch looking at the lastlog
yeah I can SO not type today

I see the ii in several lines. Now I'm playing with something I read in technomania and it's loading drivers. I put some chinese video card that someone gave me in - and it seems like it is an Nvidia card. At present, trying to load the driver/s.
~ got ya. I use ATI (almost as bad) so can't help with the nvidia but it should be pretty much loading the related nvidia driver from non-free if its a newer card
I do declare, 10.04 took 10 minutes to get going from the liveCD. Is this normal? (Dell 4600)

errr don't do bold.
that's nasty
